results.lead_paragraph: President Kennedy announced to the nation last night that he had ordered a resumption of atmospheric nuclear tests in late April unless the Soviet Union agreed by then to an iron-clad treaty banning all nuclear tests. In a radio-television address from his White House office, he said that "no single decision of this Administration has been more thoroughly or more thoughtfully weighed."

headline.main: After Khrushchev Who? What? How?; A consideration of how his successor may be chosen when the time comes, and of what kind of man he may be, tells much about Russia today. After Khrushchev Who?

results.snippet: AMONG the leaders of the world, Nikita Khrushchev, at 67, seems only middle-aged. Yet for a  man at the center of one of the century's more violent political maelstroms, and with a bad kidney at that, the Soviet leader is rapidly approaching his...
results.lead_paragraph: AMONG the leaders of the world, Nikita Khrushchev, at 67, seems only middle-aged. Yet for a man at the center of one of the century's more violent political maelstroms, and with a bad kidney at that, the Soviet leader is rapidly approaching his actuarial, if not actual limits. His colleagues in the Soviet hierarchy cannot be blamed for thinking beyond him and neither can we.

results.snippet: THE Project Mercury stamp issued Feb. 20 within minutes after Lieut. Col. John H. Glenn Jr. completed his orbital flight is not likely to be a scarce item. In addition to a first printing of 120,000,000, the Post Office Department is printing another...
results.lead_paragraph: THE Project Mercury stamp issued Feb. 20 within minutes after Lieut. Col. John H. Glenn Jr. completed his orbital flight is not likely to be a scarce item. In addition to a first printing of 120,000,000, the Post Office Department is printing another 100,000,000 to satisfy the demands of collectors and, apparently, thousands of non-collectors who want a memento of the historic feat.

results.snippet: WASHINGTON, March 30 (UPI) Maj. Donald K. Slayton's fellow astonauts have appealed to President Kennedy to reverse the decision disqualifying him from the second United States orbital space flight, it became known today.
results.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 30 (UPI) Maj. Donald K. Slayton's fellow astonauts have appealed to President Kennedy to reverse the decision disqualifying him from the second United States orbital space flight, it became known today.

headline.main: Two Guitarists at Village Gate; Flamenco Virtuosity of Sabicas Silences Cabaret Audiences Sam Hopkins Sings Negro Folk Blues With Wry Humor

results.snippet: There is a deceptive atmosphere of cool reserve when the two master musicians at the Village Gate make their appearances. But in a matter of moments Sabicas, the flamenco guitarist, and Sam (Lightning) Hopkins, the Texas blues man, start a heat wave...
results.lead_paragraph: There is a deceptive atmosphere of cool reserve when the two master musicians at the Village Gate make their appearances. But in a matter of moments Sabicas, the flamenco guitarist, and Sam (Lightning) Hopkins, the Texas blues man, start a heat wave with their music.

results.abstract: 7 Mercury astronauts accept Houston, Tex, home bldrs offer of free, furnished homes

headline.main: Homes for Astronauts

results.snippet: HOUSTON, March 30 (AP) A lawyer said today that the nation's seven astronauts had accepted offers by Houston's home building industry to give them free homes.
results.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON, March 30 (AP) A lawyer said today that the nation's seven astronauts had accepted offers by Houston's home building industry to give them free homes.
